result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton V Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clayton V Schultz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clayton V Schultz was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must complete assessment for batterers. Defendant is to continue following recommendations from mental health provider.
Defendant is to complete an assessment for substance abuse and follow through with recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton V Schultz

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Clayton V Schultz in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Clayton V Schultz.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF26 and 22CT02

Atty Zaleski is heard, defendant will be pleading to substantial battery, the remaining charges to be dismissed. 
Atty Steiner confirms agreement. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews min/max penalties section with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with the defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court asks for the defendants plea to count 2. Defendant enters plea of guilty to count 2. Court accepts defendants plea of guilty and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily entered plea. Court finds defendant guilty of count 2. 

Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 are dismissed in 22CF26
22CT02 dismissed. 

State recommends 3.5 years in the state prison system. 18 months initial confinement, followed by 24 months of extended supervision. 
Atty Zaleski is heard. Sentence credit of 60 days. 
State does not object to the sentence credit.
Court states 59 days sentence credit will be given. 
Atty Zaleski is heard on sentence request. Wisconsin resource center. Consider probation. 
No comment by Defendant. 

Court puts findings on the record. 

Court orders 3.5 years in the state prison system. 18 months initial confinement, followed by 24 months of extended supervision. Conditions of extended supervision: assessment for substance abuse. Assessment for batterers. Any programming defendant is eligible for. Follow through with recommended treatment. Continue following recommendations from mental health provider. Eligible for earned release and Challenge Incarceration. 59 days jail credit. Court costs.

The original document was titled: Neuropsychological Evaluation - Clayton Schultz
The original history event date is: 06-16-2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:07 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Clayton V Schultz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Clayton V Schultz.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Zaleski is heard on status.  Requests another status or a tentative plea and sentencing.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:26 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Clayton V Schultz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Clayton V Schultz, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF26 - Preliminary Hearing
Atty Zaleski is ready to go forward. 
Atty Steiner calls first witness.

1W - Casey Cox, sworn
Exam by Atty Steiner 
Cross by Atty Zaleski 

DA requests matter be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Zaleski objects bind over.

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
Atty Zaleski is ready to move forward with arraignment. 
2:40pm - DA will file information. 
2:45pm - Clerk brought over information. 

Atty Zaleski waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

22CT02 - Adjourned initial appearance. 
Atty Zaleski was assigned to this case as well. Has not had a chance to discuss this case with his client. 
Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Court is heard - Defendant has a sentencing after revocation coming up on March 23rd.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

4:05 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Clayton V Schultz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Steven Zaleski appears via zoom for Def. Clayton Schultz.
     Atty. Zaleski states may set for prelim. hrg. or waiver of hrg. for the CF case; not sure if Pub. Def. apptd. for the CM case; will set the CM case for an adjourned initial appearance.
     Court concludes at 4:08 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance for 22CT02 and preliminary hearing for 22CF26 scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Atty. Steven Zaleski apptd.
Atty. Steven Zaleski apptd.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:15 PM Defendant Clayton V Schultz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court notes Def. does qualify for Pub. Def., but no atty. available today.  Court will continue, but will adjust date pending atty. apptd.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State Public Defender's Office indicates that Mr. Schultz DOES qualify for a Public Defender.  However; their office will not have an attorney for him prior to his hearing on 2/14/22.

1:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Clayton V Schultz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Defendant comments.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
